alert.note: Alert for Logan; Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 1:06PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mingo and western Logan Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 105 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Delbarton, or near Williamson, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Logan, Man, Delbarton, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Chief Logan State, Holden, Mallory, Red Jacket, Chattaroy, Buskirk, Amherstdale-Robinette, Matewan, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Chauncey, Myrtle, Bruno and Sarah Ann. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
